properties.areaDesc: Curry County; Chaves County Plains; Roosevelt County
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 8:21AM MST until February 5 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...MORE SNOW EXPECTED FOR CENTRAL AND EASTERN NEW MEXICO...

.A storm system will bring wintry weather to much of central and
eastern New Mexico through at least this evening. Up to 8 inches
of snowfall is possible across the peaks and west facing slopes
while up to 4 inches could fall in the high valleys, eastern
highlands and plains. Temperatures will stay below freezing today
which will cause roadways to become icy and snowpacked, especially
along the I-25 corridor from Las Vegas to Raton Pass as well as
mountain passes and I-40 from the east mountain communities to the
Texas border.

* WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, with locally
up to 5 inches.

* WHERE...Curry County, Roosevelt County and Chaves County
Plains.

* WHEN...Until 6 AM MST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery and icy road conditions. The
hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of falling and blowing snow
may reduce visibility below 1 mile.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST WEDNESDAY
